meanings.sent1: After cheering at the game, his voice became hoarser.
meanings.sent2: Her hoarser voice made it difficult to understand her.
meanings.sent3: The parrot tried to imitate the hoarser voice of the pirate.
meanings.sent4: The wind howled through the trees, sounding hoarser than ever.
meanings.sent5: The old record player crackled, making the music sound hoarser.

meanings.definition: Becoming rough or harsh in sound.
meanings.sent1: The hoarser sound of the engine indicated a problem.
meanings.sent2: The hoarser notes of the violin added emotion to the music.
meanings.sent3: The hoarser laughter from the clown made everyone giggle.
meanings.sent4: The hoarser wind whistled through the cracks in the window.
meanings.sent5: The hoarser tone of the bell signaled the end of the day.
